questions.subject: ComfyUI
questions.question: How can I conveniently use fewer nodes in ComfyUI to achieve the same results?
questions.answer: The document suggests using workflow in the 'blogs' repo to utilize less nodes.

questions.subject: tdxh_node_comfyui
questions.question: How do I install the tdxh_node_comfyui nodes?
questions.answer: Navigate to the 'custom_nodes' directory and clone the repository using git.

questions.subject: Translator model
questions.question: What additional files do I need to download to use the translator model offline?
questions.answer: Download the translator models from the Hugging Face repository and place them in a 'model' folder within the current repository.

questions.subject: tdxh_node_comfyui
questions.question: Where can I find the model folder structure of the tdxh_node_comfyui repository?
questions.answer: The model folder structure is located at 'model/mbart-large-50 viciss_only_to_English/'.Â

questions.subject: tdxh_node_comfyui
questions.question: How do I install the required dependencies for the tdxh_node_comfyui nodes?
questions.answer: Run the command 'pip install -r requirements.txt' in the current repository directory.

questions.subject: ComfyUI
questions.question: Where can I find the source code for ComfyUI?
questions.answer: The main code for ComfyUI can be found on the official GitHub repository: https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI.git.

questions.subject: Custom nodes
questions.question: Which other custom nodes are compatible with ComfyUI?
questions.answer: The document mentions the 'was-node-suite-comfyui' node as another custom node compatible with ComfyUI.

questions.subject: Prompt translator
questions.question: Where can I find the source code for the translator model used in the tdxh_node_comfyui repository?
questions.answer: The main code for the translator is available at https://github.com/ParisNeo/prompt_translator.git.
